channel.title: WSJ.com: World News
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Britain’s Royals Give Up Their Luxury Train in the Name of Fiscal Restraint
item.description: Despite receiving a near-record boost in funding, the royal family has decided it is the end of the line for its locomotive service.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Iran Suspected of Scouting Jewish Targets in Europe
item.description: German authorities say a Danish national arrested last week is suspected of surveilling potential targets in Berlin.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Norway’s Largest Private Pension Fund Drops Two Defense Groups Over Weapons Used in Gaza
item.description: The KLP private pension fund excluded the U.S.’s Oshkosh and Germany’s Thyssenkrupp from its portfolio, citing their sales of weapons to the Israeli military.
item.dc:creator: Cristina Gallardo

item.title: Leaked Phone Call Leads to Suspension of Thai Prime Minister
item.description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra has been accused of violating ethical standards in her handling of a border row with Cambodia.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Kim Jong Un Publicly Mourns Troops Killed Fighting for Russia for First Time
item.description: Photos of the leader were the first shared with North Koreans showing the country’s contributions to Russia’s war with Ukraine, with more deployments ahead.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: For Iran’s Nuclear Program, a Month Is Longer Than It Sounds
item.description: Some of the most important considerations for Tehran on the road to a nuclear weapon are political, not technical, and every delay complicates its calculations.
item.dc:creator: Laurence Norman

item.title: Opinion | Trump Tries to Issue a Pardon—in Israel
item.description: He wants the Jewish state to call off the Netanyahu trial, but it isn’t his country.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Trump Lifts Sanctions on Syria as It Holds Talks on Diplomatic Ties With Israel
item.description: Middle East adversaries Israel and Syria have held discussions for weeks about normalization, officials say.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Opinion | Trump Seeks to Remake the World
item.description: He wants as much executive power as possible and the U.S. the top global player.
item.dc:creator: Walter Russell Mead

item.title: ‘Death to the IDF’ Chant at Glastonbury Music Festival Sparks Uproar
item.description: The BBC apologized as British Prime Minister Keir Starmer criticized the state broadcaster for airing a punk duo live. The group’s visa to tour the U.S. was canceled.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: Opinion | Let’s Not Go Wobbly on Iran
item.description: If the president believes he can turn a hungry beast into a vegetarian, he is being uncharacteristically naive.

item.title: EU Trade Chief Plans Trip to Washington as Tariff Deadline Looms
item.description: The European Union’s top trade official will head to Washington this week for talks as Brussels’ officials race to secure a deal before a key deadline expires next week.
item.dc:creator: Edith Hancock

item.title: Israeli Military Reorganizes Operations Around Aid Centers After Rash of Shootings
item.description: New signs and barriers are aimed at reducing danger to civilians under controversial new aid program.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Canada Rescinds Digital-Services Tax to Salvage Trade Discussions With U.S.
item.description: Carney and Trump will try to reach an agreement by July 21, a Canadian spokeswoman said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Eurozone National Debt Issuance Rises as Defense Spending Swells
item.description: Germany, Finland and Belgium last week all raised their estimated borrowing needs, early evidence of how higher defense spending in Europe is starting to affect national finances and sovereign-debt issuance.
item.dc:creator: Emese Bartha

item.title: Violent Settlers Turn on Israeli Military After Attacking Palestinians in West Bank
item.description: The incident highlights the lack of law and order in parts of the occupied territory, where Israelis associated with the settler movement have increasingly attacked Palestinians without consequences.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: China’s Communist Party Now Has 100 Million Members. Many Are in It for the Paycheck.
item.description: In a sluggish economy, membership is seen as a path to a stable state-sector income.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: German Inflation Unexpectedly Cools Despite Recent Oil-Price Rise
item.description: Consumer prices were 2.0% higher than a year ago, down from the 2.1% inflation rate of May, and lower than what polled economists had expected.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Buying U.S. Arms Will Help Europe Unlock Trade Deal With Trump, EU Leader Says
item.description: European Council chief António Costa says NATO members’ pledge to spend more on defense will rebalance the bloc’s trade relations with America.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: How Israel Killed Iran’s Top Nuclear Scientists
item.description: The targeted attacks showed Israel’s intelligence prowess, but a new generation of Iranian scientists could blunt the impact.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Russia Masses 50,000 Troops Around Sumy, Putting Ukraine in Precarious Position
item.description: Holding the Russians off has become a game of whack-a-mole for outnumbered Ukrainian troops, with Russia frequently opening new lines of attack.
item.dc:creator: Nikita Nikolaienko

item.title: Opinion | Iran Remains a Menace in the Americas
item.description: Tehran has spies and proxies across Latin America and probably in the U.S. as well.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: Opinion | The Case for Space Defense
item.description: The U.S. faces dangerous adversaries but has the tools to create a strong missile-defense system.
item.dc:creator: J.D. Crouch II

item.title: How Israel-Aligned Hackers Hobbled Iran’s Financial System
item.description: Broken cash machines, halted payments and a crippled crypto exchange were all the result of pro-Israeli efforts that came on top of this month’s bombing campaign.
item.dc:creator: Angus Berwick

item.title: The Coup Leader Who’s Become an Anti-Western Hero in Africa and Beyond
item.description: Ibrahim Traoré, Burkina Faso’s leader, counts admirers from Nairobi to Jamaica and London. Russia is also courting him.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: China Steals Language and Home Life From Tibetan Kids as Young as 4
item.description: Beijing is building a broad network of preschools across Tibetan areas, seeking to inculcate loyalty to the Chinese Communist Party early in life.
item.dc:creator: Niharika Mandhana

item.title: Europe Is Recruiting Academics Disenchanted With America
item.description: The U.K., France and other countries have set up funds to help U.S. researchers relocate to the continent.
item.dc:creator: Nidhi Subbaraman

item.title: Life in Iran After the Strikes: Executions, Arrests and Paranoia
item.description: Security forces emerge from hiding to set up checkpoints, hunt for moles and tell residents to watch their neighbors for spies.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Taiwan Looks to New Sea-Drone Tech to Repel China
item.description: The island plans to start introducing sea drones to its naval forces this year as part of preparations for what it sees as a potential invasion by China as soon as 2027.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: The Grandfathers Fighting on Ukraine’s Front Lines
item.description: Ukraine has resisted drafting young men, anxious to protect the country’s long-term future. That means there is a lot of gray hair on the battlefield.
item.dc:creator: Serhii Korovayny

item.title: Trump Says He Has Terminated Trade Talks With Canada
item.description: The president blames what he calls an “egregious” digital-services tax on U.S. tech companies.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Opinion | Zohran Mamdani and the Jews
item.description: What do Democrats have to say about their Israel-hating nominee to run New York City?
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Congo and Rwanda Sign a Peace Accord in Washington
item.description: The deal opens critical mineral deposits to U.S. investment.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Trump Says U.S. Won’t Lift Iran Sanctions
item.description: In a social-media post, the president attacks Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei just days after the cease-fire between Tehran and Israel.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Andrews

item.title: Netanyahu Took a Giant Gamble in Confronting Iran. It Paid Off.
item.description: The normally risk-averse Israeli leader struck Iran without the promise of U.S. aid but with a shrewd sense of Trump’s likely reaction.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: Mexico Takes Over Two Small Local Banks and a Brokerage Firm Sanctioned by Washington
item.description: The U.S. Treasury accused CIBanco, Intercam Banco and Vector Casa de Bolsa of money laundering and facilitating payments related to fentanyl.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: China Confirms Breakthrough on Rare-Earth Exports to U.S.
item.description: The announcement offered hope of a reprieve on shortages that have hit American industry, and came after President Trump said he signed a deal with China.
item.dc:creator: Brian Spegele

item.title: A Remote Himalayan Kingdom Bet Big on Bitcoin Mining. So Far, It Has Paid Off.
item.description: Many countries are studying ways to use crypto, but being a crypto pioneer doesn’t come without risk.
item.dc:creator: Aakash Hassan

item.title: Israel’s War With Iran Has Reordered the Middle East—but Not as Expected
item.description: Israel’s military success against Iran undermines one incentive for Saudi normalization and raises concerns about its growing power.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: U.S. Attack on Iran’s Nuclear Program Risks Emboldening North Korea’s Kim
item.description: The strikes potentially hardened Kim Jong Un’s determination to hold on to—and expand—his nuclear arsenal as a deterrent to any attack on North Korea.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: U.K. Pay Growth Has Some Way to Go Before It Normalizes, Says BOE’s Bailey
item.description: U.K. businesses are trimming jobs and pay in response to higher employment taxes, the head of the Bank of England said.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: China Is Still Choking Exports of Rare Earths Despite Pact With U.S.
item.description: Western companies are struggling to secure approvals for rare-earth imports from Chinese authorities, despite the U.S.-China deal.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: Vietnam Legal Changes Set to Spare Convicted Tycoon’s Life
item.description: Vietnam’s parliament voted to remove the death penalty for several offenses, including embezzlement, sparing the life of Truong My Lan whose $12 billion fraud conviction riveted the nation.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: How Trump Cajoled Iran and Israel Into a Cease-Fire and Forced Them to Comply
item.description: It remains to be seen how long the truce will hold and whether it will pave the way for a nuclear deal between the U.S. and Iran.
item.dc:creator: Summer Said

item.title: Trump Set on Tariff Demands as Canada Negotiations Head Toward Deadline, Canadian Ambassador Says
item.description: In the short-term, Canada is trying to get the U.S. to back down from 50% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports and levies on autos, said Kirsten Hillman, Canada’s ambassador to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Vipal Monga

item.title: Canada’s Carney Pledges Deeper Ties With Allies to Offset U.S. Trade Uncertainty
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister’s remarks in Brussels came as he and senior EU officials agreed on a new bilateral relationship that envisages closer ties between Canada and the bloc on defense, digital policy, supply chains, and security.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Oil Workers, Snagged in a Dispute Over a Dictator’s Son’s Yacht, Are Freed After Two Years
item.description: Equatorial Guinea’s President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo freed two South African oilmen who were imprisoned in apparent retaliation for the seizing in Cape Town of assets of the president’s son.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: U.S. Prepares Action Targeting Allies’ Chip Plants in China
item.description: A U.S. official told top global semiconductor makers he wanted to revoke waivers they have used to access American technology in China, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Raffaele Huang

item.title: China Flexes Chokehold on Rare-Earth Magnets as Exports Plunged in May
item.description: Curbs on magnets used in electric vehicles and jet fighters are at the core of recent U.S.-China trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Feng

item.title: Air India Crash Investigators Recover Black Boxes as Death Toll Hits 265
item.description: An early focus of the probe includes a possible loss or reduction of thrust.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tangel

item.title: The Man in Seat 11A Who Walked Away From the Air India Crash
item.description: Britain’s Viswashkumar Ramesh said he doesn’t know why he survived, while more than 200 others, including his brother, died. In India, he has become known as the miracle of window seat 11A.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Air India Boeing Crash Kills Hundreds, Leaves Sole Survivor
item.description: The Boeing jet carrying 242 people crashed in a residential area shortly after takeoff. Only one person survived the crash, the first fatal incident for Boeing’s Dreamliner aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Anne Merriman, Who Brought Hospice Care to Africa, Dies at 90
item.description: Known in Africa as “the mother of palliative care,” she established a model for pain management and end-of-life care.
item.dc:creator: Jon Mooallem

item.title: Scores Killed in Heavy Flooding in South Africa
item.description: Torrential rain, severe winds and landslides have killed at least 49 people in the poverty-stricken Eastern Cape province of South Africa.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Russia’s Top Peace Negotiator Is Historian Who Justified the War
item.description: Vladimir Medinsky warned, in an interview, that Ukraine would lose more territory if it doesn’t agree to Moscow’s demands.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: Ukraine Says It Destroyed Dozens of Warplanes Deep Inside Russia
item.description: The clandestine drone attack deals the biggest blow of the war against Moscow’s long-range bomber fleet.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lytvynenko

item.title: Putin Has Retooled Russia’s Economy to Focus Only on War
item.description: Moscow has expanded military recruitment and boosted weapons production. Peace could jeopardize the resulting economic gains.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Trump Says Putin Is ‘Playing With Fire’
item.description: The president has indicated he is weighing additional sanctions on Russia, potentially as soon as this week.
item.dc:creator: Annie Linskey

item.title: British Police Investigate Fires at Properties Linked to Prime Minister
item.description: British counterterrorism police are probing a string of suspected arson attacks on two properties linked to Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.K. Plans to Tighten Rules After Record Influx of Migrants
item.description: Britain’s government said a record influx of foreigners since Brexit had done little to energize the economy.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: India, Pakistan Cease-Fire Brokered by U.S. Appears to Hold
item.description: The neighbors had agreed to a full and immediate cease-fire in the worst violence between them for more than two decades.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Who Joined Putin in Moscow to Celebrate Victory Day
item.description: More than 20 world leaders gathered in Red Square to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Men Found Guilty of Felling Famous Tree in ‘Moronic Mission’ That Gripped U.K.
item.description: The pair’s destruction of the beloved Sycamore Gap tree stoked nationwide anger and a criminal investigation.
item.dc:creator: Alistair MacDonald

item.title: JD Vance Sees an India That America Can Work With
item.description: The vice president says India and the U.S. are making progress in trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: France’s Macron Tries to Quell New Caledonia Riots With Globe-Crossing Trip
item.description: The French leader said he is open to suspending a voting-rights bill that sparked the riots once order is restored on the archipelago and talks resume between rival factions.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Meichtry

item.title: France Rushes Reinforcements to Riot-Stricken New Caledonia
item.description: Unrest in the overseas territory could derail President Emmanuel Macron’s efforts to restore French influence in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Australia to Boost Defense Spending Amid U.S.-China Tensions
item.description: Australia is boosting its defense budget and rethinking its defense plans as strategic competition between the U.S. and China heats up in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
